2. Message from Mayor Womack regarding the North Brunswick Food Bank

Message from Mayor Womack regarding the North Brunswick Food Bank
=================================================================

**To the Residents of North Brunswick Regarding the North Brunswick Food Bank**

North Brunswick residents join Americans across our nation in experiencing heavy impacts of the ongoing government shutdown. Many of our neighbors are facing sudden financial strain as paychecks are delayed, federal programs are paused, and assistance systems are stretched thin. Food insecurity is growing rapidly among families who have never before needed help.

I am reaching out to ask for your partnership and compassion during this difficult time. Your kindness and humanity can make a profound difference for families in need.

Here are a few ways Residents might be able to help the North Brunswick Food Bank:

**Host or sponsor a community food drive** to donate to the North Brunswick Food Bank.

**Contribute funds** to The North Brunswick Food Bank. Cash or Checks only please.

**Spread the word** to those who may be struggling or who can help sustain these efforts.

Here are a few examples of what the North Brunswick Food Bank Needs Most:

Cereal

Oatmeal

Peanut Butter

Jelly/Jam

Pasta

Pasta Sauce (No Glass Please)

Beans

Tuna

Canned Fruit

Canned Vegetables

Mac & Cheese

Soup

Stew

Snacks

Rice

Jello

Powdered Milk

Juice

Pudding

Toiletries

The North Brunswick Food Bank is located within the North Brunswick Senior Center at [15 Linwood Place, North Brunswick NJ 08902](https://link.edgepilot.com/s/05726701/nY3mJBP_50qSBlSwXfiV_g?u=https://www.google.com/maps/search/15%2BLinwood%2BPlace%2C%2BNorth%2BBrunswick%2BNJ%2B08902?entry=gmail%26source=g).

The Food Bank is open for Donation drop off Monday through Friday from 8:30 am to 3:30 pm.

For who need assistance, the food bank is open Tuesdays from 10:00 am—12:00pm and Thursdays from 6:00pm—7:30pm.

We are happy to help coordinate efforts and to lend any help possible. I hope you will feel free to contact my assistant, Michelle Greder (732) 247-0922 Ext 201, or Director of Recreation and Community Services, Lou Ann Benson (732) 247-0922 Ext. 262 for any assistance we can render.

Thank you for your continued kindness, compassion, and faith in action. Together, we can ensure that no family in our community goes hungry during this challenging time.

With gratitude and hope,

**Francis M. Womack III**  
Mayor  
North Brunswick Township
